alert.note: Alert for Collier (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following county, Collier. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 843 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rains moving through the metro areas of Collier County. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen from the earlier heavy rains today. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. with the heavy rains during the next couple of year. If the rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then a Flash Flood warning may be needed for this area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Naples, Golden Gate Estates, Golden Gate, Vineyards, West Toll Gate On Alligator Alley, North Naples, Orangetree, Lely Resort, East Naples, Naples Manor, Naples Park, Quail Creek Estate, Lely, Pelican Bay and Corkscrew Swamp Sanctuary. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely.
